newsitem.title: USA: CME July lumber up $10 limit on stronger cash tone.
newsitem.headline: CME July lumber up $10 limit on stronger cash tone.

text.p: CME July lumber futures rose the $10.00 per thousand board foot limit on scattered buying prompted by a stronger tone to the cash lumber market, traders said.
At 1038 CDT July lumber futures were limit up at $362.40 per tbf while other months were up $7.50 to $4.60.

Futures moved up on word of a pickup in trade and higher prices being paid for eastern spruce studs. This followed the recent break in cash lumber that took prices down to $350 per tbf for spruce, the lowest price since July 12, 1996, traders said.
"The market is showing some signs of improving here and there," said Curt Cunningham, president of Pacific Futures Trading.
